trans-unit.source: Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that provides access to files that were uploaded by a client.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollectionWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollectionBase> class and serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollection> class.
This class exposes the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollection> class while also exposing the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollectionBase> type.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollectionBase> class enables you to replace the original implementation of the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollection> class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpFileCollectionWrapper"></xref> class.
The object that this wrapper class provides access to.
httpApplicationState is `null`.
Gets an array that contains the keys (names) of all posted file objects in the collection.
An array of file names.
Copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at the specified index in the array.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying starts.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the source object is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
The type of the source <xref href="System.Web.HttpFileCollectionWrapper"></xref> object cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.
Gets the number of objects in the collection.
The number of objects in the collection.
Returns the posted file object at the specified index.
The index of the item to return.
The posted file object specified by index.
index is outside the valid range of indexes for the collection.
Returns the posted file object that has the specified name from the collection.
The name of the object to return.
The posted file object specified by name, if found; otherwise, `null`.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
An object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Returns the name of the posted file object at the specified index.
The index of the object name to return.
The name of the posted file object that is specified by index.
index is outside the valid range of indexes for the collection.
Returns all files that match the specified name.
The name to match.
The files that match the specified name.
Returns the data that is required in order to serialize the <xref href="System.Web.HttpFileCollectionWrapper"></xref> object.
The information that is required in order to serialize the <xref href="System.Web.HttpFileCollectionWrapper"></xref> object.
The source and destination of the serialized stream that is associated with the <xref href="System.Web.HttpFileCollectionWrapper"></xref> object.
Gets a value that indicates whether access to the collection is thread-safe.
`true` if access is synchronized (thread-safe); otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets the posted file object at the specified index.
The index of the item to get.
The posted file object specified by index.
index is outside the valid range of indexes for the collection.
Gets the posted file object that has the specified name from the collection.
The name of the object to get.
The posted file object specified by name, if found; otherwise, `null`.

Gets a <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameObjectCollectionBase.KeysCollection"></xref> instance that contains all the keys in the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationStateWrapper"></xref> instance.
A collection that contains all the keys in the collection.
Raises the deserialization event when deserialization is finished.
The source of the deserialization event.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that is associated with the current <xref href="System.Web.HttpFileCollectionWrapper"></xref> instance is invalid.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
